title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live on Wednesday 17 May 2017 - BBC News
summary: police given more time to question murder suspects .
body found in search for missing man .
cyber attack causes surge in a & e visitors .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 thursday .

documents.title: leicester city 1-6 tottenham hotspur
text: leicester city 1-6 tottenham hotspur
author: Tom Rostance
BBC Sport

documents.title: man charged over pensioner 'row ' death
text: man charged over pensioner 'row ' death

documents.title: houses searched over car crash body
text: houses searched over car crash body

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from the east midlands live page - updates will start again at 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: weather : rain easing overnight
text: cloud and rain will steadily move eastwards overnight .
conditions will slowly become drier and clearer .
it 'll feel cooler with lows of 8c ( 46f ) .
for thursday there 'll be variable amounts of cloud with a mixture of sunshine and showers .
some of the showers could be quite sharp at times but it 'll feel pleasant in any sunny spells .
highs of 17c ( 63f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: first co-op dementia friendly store in derbyshire
text: the first dementia friendly store has been announced by the central england co-op and it is in derbyshire .
the society has linked up with amber valley dementia action alliance and now the ripley co-op store has been improved to help people with the condition .

staff in the store have also been given specialist training to allow them to help customers affected by the dementia - and new signage has been put in place in order to remove confusion for anyone shopping who has the condition .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shadow chancellor visits derby north
text: the shadow chancellor john mcdonnell was in derby today as campaigning continues for the general election .
the labour battle bus stopped in the derby north constituency which was the most marginal seat in england at the last election .
despite the heavy rain , he spoke to voters and told radio derby how labour hopes to invest and renationalise the railways .
he talked about how keen they are to get christopher williamson back in parliament .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: chest injuries caused ride girl 's death
text: chest injuries caused ride girl 's death

documents.title: rare car stolen in buxton burglary
text: a rare classic car has been stolen in a burglary at a house in buxton .
police are trying to trace the bright red triumph tr5 which was taken between 12 and 13 may from a house on lascelles road .
police say the burglars took the keys from inside the property and drove off with the classic car .
they want to hear from anyone who 's been offered the car or parts from it in the last few days .
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: great weather for ducks
text: you know it 's been raining a lot when the ducks are walking around jubilee square in leicester
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: forest buy-out 'moves forward '
text: we understand a meeting between evangelos marinakis and the football league has taken place and the greek takeover of nottingham forest is nearing a conclusion .
the club 's manager mark warburton has said he expects the new owners to be aggressively ambitious and and that he 's looking forward to the future at the club .
here 's more from warburton
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: man charged over death of pensioner
text: a man has been charged with manslaughter following the death of a pensioner after an alleged altercation in derbyshire .
derek levers , 86 , collapsed at his address after the reported row in station road , ilkeston , and later died in hospital .
ryan belfon , 31 , of stapleton road , ilkeston , has been charged with manslaughter .
he has also been charged with criminal damage , assaulting a police officer and fraud offences , derbyshire police said .
mr belfon is due before southern derbyshire magistrates ' court on thursday .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: chesterfield sign defender el fitouri
text: chesterfield sign defender el fitouri

documents.title: breakingdrayton manor death : evha jannath 'died from chest injuries '
text: the initial investigation into the death of an 11-year-old girl who fell from a theme park water ride has found she died from chest injuries .
evha jannath was on a school trip when she fell from the splash canyon ride at drayton manor theme park on 9 may .
staffordshire police says a post-mortem examination 's been carried out and that an inquest has been opened and adjourned this afternoon .
the force says no date 's been set for the full inquest and they and the health and safety executive are continuing their investigation .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: notts county sign striker ameobi
text: notts county sign striker ameobi

documents.title: forest 's lica rejoins estoril on loan
text: forest 's lica rejoins estoril on loan

documents.title: money raised for funeral of megan bannister
text: an online fundraising page has been set up to raise money for the funeral of 16-year-old megan bannister who was found dead in the back of a car in enderby on sunday .
the person that set up the crowdfunding page said : `` this would be a massive help in allowing megan to have that special day she deserves . ''
the page aims to raise £ 3,000 towards funeral costs - any money left over will go to the maternity ward at the leicester royal infirmary in megan 's honour .
the teenager was hoping to become a midwife .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mansfield bring in defender diamond
text: mansfield bring in defender diamond

documents.title: forest takeover 'edging to conclusion '
text: forest takeover 'edging to conclusion '

documents.title: tributes left for teen found dead after crash
text: flowers have been left for 16-year-old megan bannister who was found dead in the back of a car in enderby on sunday .
the tributes are on desford road where the teenager was involved in a crash between a car and motorbike .
her death however is not believed to have been the result of the crash and a murder investigation has been launched .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jobs at risk at pet food manufacturer
text: about 64 jobs are at risk at the pet food manufacture mars petcare uk in melton mowbray .
the company has said the restructure will affect those involved in `` canning '' the product .
we have proposed a restructure relating to our canning line , to ensure that our factory in melton mowbray remains fit for the future .
our priority at this time is supporting our associates who are aware of the proposal and are taking part in a consultation process .
a final decision on the restructure will be made following this period of consultation . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire in hospital maternity unit
text: there 's been a fire at the maternity unit at nottingham city hospital this afternoon .
patients have been evacuated to another part of the hospital following the fire on lawrence ward - the antenatal and postnatal ward .
the hospital has said no patients have been injured and the fire has now been put out .
patients are expected to be able to return to the ward as soon as it is safe to do so .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: house searched in murder investigation
text: police have confirmed searches have been carried out in connection with the investigation into the death of megan bannister .
officers have been at an address in braunstone avenue in leicester .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: birdman of burton 's robin friendship
text: we 've all heard of the saying a dog is a man 's best friend - well in this case a robin is a man 's best friend .
john anderson from burton is best mates with a robin .
the robin - imaginatively named robin - pops into john 's house , sits on his hand and eats cheese yes , cheese .
they 're so inseparable , robin even rides around with john in his car .
their friendship began last winter and in that space of time robin and john have built up a very good relationship and when john calls , robin appears .
last winter he started coming for food .
i started putting cheese out for him on the wheelie bin top then began edging closer and closer and he eventually started eating from my hand .
in the spring he was calling for a friend and mrs robin turned up and he used to bring her cheese . ''
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: vehicles caught breaking weight limit on ancient bridge
text: six drivers have been caught breaking the weight limit on swarkestone bridge during a joint operation by police and trading standards yesterday .
the action was in response to complaints that some drivers were ignoring the restrictions on the ancient causeway .
police say that one driver was also issued with a fixed penalty for using his mobile phone during yesterday 's crackdown .
we often receive complaints about heavy goods vehicles driving over the causeway , an ancient monument and narrow piece of road , which is not designed for such vehicles .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: firm 'reassuring ' residents over incinerator
text: the company envirofusion which wants to build an experimental incinerator in derby has told local people the plant wo n't affect their quality of life .
the facility , off alfreton road , is intended to operate for 18 months , while the technology inside it is tested .
residents are fighting the plans , but chief executive andrew morris said they 're doing all they can to reassure residents that the unit is safe .

we 've actually got some of the people who have made those objections coming to see us tomorrow - hopefully we can talk them through what we 're actually going to do and allay their fears and show them how much work we 're putting in in trying to make sure there is no affect on them or the local neighbourhood .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : derbyshire defeated by worcestershire
text: in cricket , derbyshire falcons ended their run in the one day cup yesterday with a defeat to worcestershire rapids .
it was a difficult day for the falcons who faced a long rain delay in the middle of their innings .
in the end , they lost by five wickets following the duckworth-lewis method .
fast-bowler hardus viljoen said it was important to learn from the experience .
we are a young team .
we 've shown in patches in this competition that we can play good cricket but we are also still learning .

documents.title: street murder 'may have been filmed '
text: street murder 'may have been filmed '

documents.title: ambitious plans for old viaduct revealed
text: ambitious plans are underway to bring a landmark on the nottinghamshire/derbyshire border back into use .
the charity sustrans is bidding for £ 6m to restore the bennerley viaduct between awsworth and eastwood into a cycling and walking route .
the group friends of bennerley viaduct hope it 'll boost tourism .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: delays to train services as man hit by train
text: a man has been hit by a train at a level crossing in attenborough between nottingham and east midlands parkway .
this is causing disruptions to routes between nottingham and london , leicester , lincoln , matlock and newark .
british transport police said the incident is not being treated as sus but it is investigating how the man came to be on the tracks .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: afternoon weather : heavy rain
text: it 'll rain for most of the afternoon and at times the rain could be heavy with some tricky driving conditions possible due to standing water and spray .
highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: dog back with owners after three years
text: dog back with owners after three years

documents.title: how snail romance could help human genetics
text: scientists at the university of nottingham have been running their own dating program - for snails .
it all started with jeremy the `` one in a million '' rare mutant garden snail who has an anti-clockwise spiralling shell .
it means his genitals are on the wrong side making it difficult for him to mate .
an appeal was made to find another snail with a left spiralling shell in the hope the pair could `` hook up '' and two were found - one in ipswich and one in majorca .
however things did n't quite go to plan
on a more serious note , dr angus davison reckons this study could be beneficial to humans .
last year we discovered a gene , which when variable in snails makes them coil to the left or the right .
we also found that the same gene seems to be involved in setting up the body asymmetry of our cells .
so the process of determining left and right side of the body is so deeply conserved that snails and humans are probably using the same set of genes . ''
he said there 's a chance this could lead to developments in helping people born with their organs in the wrong place .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derby county manager 'expected to make major changes ' to squad
text: the derby county manager gary rowett says if he has to separate players who are staying or going then he will .
the rams manager is expected to carry out major changes to his squad this summer .
he 's mentioned two potential deals are ongoing - but has n't had any offers for his players .
author: BBC Derby Sport

documents.title: more time to question murder suspects
text: leicestershire police have been given more time to question two men on sus of murder .
it 's after the body of 16-year-old megan bannister was found on the back seat of a car in enderby .
author: Simon Ward
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: police appeal for dashcam footage in murder investigation
text: if you 're one of those people with a dashcam in your vehicle then police are appealing to you .
it 's after a 22-year-old man was found fatally injured on st matthews way in leicester on monday afternoon .
police want to hear from drivers who were in the area at the time and may have captured some vital video footage about the murder .
we are trawling through cctv in the area surrounding st matthews way , however there may be private cctv cameras in the vicinity that we have n't identified .
we would ask anyone who owns cctv or has dashcams in their vehicles to check whether they have captured any footage from monday afternoon , which may assist with our investigation . ''
a 17-year-old man has been arrested on sus of murder and remains in police custody .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fly-tippers dump mess in bolsover
text: bolsover council is trying to track down the culprit who dumped this mess on the main road from hillstown to glapwell between 09:00 and 14:00 yesterday .
they want anyone with information to get in touch with them .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : spurs match 'will be interesting '
text: craig shakespeare has held leicester city 's pre-tottenham press conference - the foxes boss began by taking questions on that riyad mahrez penalty from the weekend .
he said : i think bizarre is the right word .
but we know the letter of the law , the ref got it right '' .
he then spoke about injuries , saying he did n't want to put a time limit on the return of wes morgan but robert huth and andy king could be ready for the final game of the season .
marc albrighton is also `` fine '' and back on the training pitch .
looking ahead to tomorrow 's home game shakespeare said : the players can see the light at the end of the tunnel '' but want to finish as high as they can .
eighth place is still possible .
he compared spurs to last weekends opponents manchester city but said : `` we 've got a great record here at the king power .
it will be more than interesting ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing whitwick man found safe
text: missing leicestershire man david moseley has been found safe and well .
the 55-year-old was reported missing from the whitwick area but was found yesterday evening .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : notts reach knockout stages despite washout
text: nottinghamshire reached the one-day cup knockout stages despite no result being possible in their match at northants .
put into bat , northants reached 79-0 with ben duckett making an unbeaten 56 before rain came after 14.4 overs .
notts needed a win against the north group 's bottom side to make sure of their qualification , but heavy rain at wantage road saw the points shared .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: man charged after woman 'punched and bitten ' in city centre
text: a 31-year-old has been charged with assault and attempting to rob a woman in derby city centre .
the man , from ilkeston , is due before southern derbyshire magistrates ' court today charged with attempted robbery and wounding with intent .
a woman was pushed to the ground , punched in the face and had her ear bitten on monday in traffic street .
a 27-year-old man who was also arrested in connection was released without charge .
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: cricket : yorkshire victorious over leicestershire
text: leicestershire 's slim hopes of making the one-day cup quarter-finals ended with defeat by yorkshire at headingley .
in a game reduced to 45 overs per side , yorkshire recovered from 98-4 to post 258-7 thanks to 71 from gary ballance and 52 not out from azeem rafiq .
leicestershire were given a flying start by cameron delport , only to slip from 107-1 to 189-8 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: police chief cycling around derbyshire before retirement
text: derbyshire 's chief constable mick creedon is marking his retirement after 37 years in the service by cycling around the county .
it 's expected to take him three days and he will be joined by other experienced cyclists .
the chief constable is aiming to raise money for safe and sound which protects vulnerable people in derby and derbyshire .
the cycling challenge will be difficult , especially with some of the hills in derbyshire - but with the right people around me i think i will be able to do it .
bradley wiggins and dave brailsford are not involved , we 'll not be racing and my ageing and often aching limbs wo n't be moving too quickly .
warning : external content may contain adverts .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: election soap box in bulwell
text: the battle for number 10 is hotting up as the parties start revealing their manifestos .
but with politicians shouting about what they 're going to do if they get into power - what is it that you really want ?
we 've been in bulwell with our soap box to ask you .
one person told us : `` i 'd cut immigration down .
i 'd only let people in who are willing to work . ''
another said tuition fees were an important issue for him because he has a son looking to go to university .
several people said they would n't be voting on the 8 june .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: scheme launched to help find people with dementia
text: a scheme has been launched today which will help derbyshire police find people with dementia who go missing .
relatives and carers of people with dementia can provide information about their loved ones - .
places they like to go , where they used to work , weekly habits - in case they wander off without warning .
tamsin bell-heather from derbyshire police says the scheme , called the 'herbert protocol ' can give officers a head start during any search .

quite often they will fall into a pattern of behaviour that they once had - so they may go out the door to go to the shop for a pint of milk , but half way down the street may think they 're going to work .
it 's making sure we have those search locations so that we can start to send officers to try and find the people at those locations . ''
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : home draw for rapids after rain-affected win
text: worcestershire rapids last night booked themselves a home draw in the semi-finals of the royal london one-day cup when they beat derbyshire falcons by five wickets in a rain-affected game in derby .
batting first , the home side made 209 for 8 in 36 overs , with ed barnard taking three wickets for worcestershire .
but half-centuries from tom kohler-cadmore ( and daryl mitchell meant the rapids made light work of their run chase reaching their revised target of 218 with four overs to spare .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: cyber attack causes surge in a & e visitors
text: the emergency department at nottingham 's queen 's medical centre saw a 50 % surge in demand following the nhs cyber attack last week .
it 's after gp surgeries shut off their computers and reverted back to the old `` pen and paper '' system .
during usual busy times there are about 80 people in the a & e but in the last few days numbers have peaked at more than 120 patients .
author: Dominic Johnson
BBC Radio Nottingham reporter

documents.title: watch : wigston building demolished
text: long street in wigston has now re-opened .
it was closed by police last night after part of a building collapsed
half of the building had to be demolished last night to make the area safe .
it now looks like this
the fire service said it is not yet sure what caused the building to collapse .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester owner to buy belgian club
text: leicester owner to buy belgian club

documents.title: travel : latest on the roads
text: there are delays in derby on the a52 between wyvern way and sir frank whittle road at pentagon island while traffic is building on queensway and kingsway towards the city centre .
the m1 isslow in both directions through junction 24 , near east midlands airport , because of the roadworks
trafficis queuing on stretches of the a52 in nottingham between the knight island and gamston island while castle boulevard in the city is very busy .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: persistent and heavy rain throughout today .
good for the gardens but a bit miserable .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: rare 'lefty ' snail left on the shelf
text: rare 'lefty ' snail left on the shelf

documents.title: body found in search for missing man
text: police looking for a missing leicestershire man have found a body in watermead park .
formal identification has not yet taken place but officers believe it to be paul richardson .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: join us for today 's live news coverage
text: good morning nottinghamshire , leicestershire and derbyshire - khia lewis-todd and i will be writing the updates on your live page today .
we 'll have all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the east midlands .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
